title: How to Develop Film With Coffee and Washing Soda

steps.headline: Fill a bucket with 1 qt.
Dissolve 10 tsp.
steps.description: (or 50 grams) of washing soda completely into the water.

steps.headline: Dissolve 4 tsp.
steps.description: (or 5 grams) of ground coffee completely into the solution.

steps.headline: Dissolve 1 tsp.
steps.description: (or 5 grams) of Vitamin C powder completely into the solution.

steps.headline: Wait up to 10 minutes for any bubbles to evaporate.
Make sure that you are in a completely dark area.
Load your film into the developing tank.
Pour the solution into the developing tank.
Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.
Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.
Continue for 10 to 20 minutes.
Pour the developing solution out.
Pour in 1 qt.
Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.
Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.
Pour out the water after 10 minutes.
Refill the tank with fresh tap water.
Pour out the water after 10 minutes.
Remove the film.
Hang the film in a corner away from light, dust, and wind.
Wait until the films are dry to see your developed images.

text: Fill a bucket with 1 qt. (or 1 lt.) of room temperature water. Dissolve 10 tsp. (or 50 grams) of washing soda completely into the water. Dissolve 4 tsp. (or 5 grams) of ground coffee completely into the solution. Dissolve 1 tsp. (or 5 grams) of Vitamin C powder completely into the solution. Wait up to 10 minutes for any bubbles to evaporate.  Make sure that you are in a completely dark area.  Load your film into the developing tank.  Pour the solution into the developing tank.  Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.  Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.  Continue for 10 to 20 minutes.  Pour the developing solution out.  Pour in 1 qt. (or 1 lt.) of tap water. Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.  Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.  Pour out the water after 10 minutes.  Refill the tank with fresh tap water. Repeat the rinse process. Pour out the water after 10 minutes.  Remove the film.  Hang the film in a corner away from light, dust, and wind.  Wait until the films are dry to see your developed images.
sentences: Fill a bucket with 1 qt.
(or 1 lt.) of room temperature water.
Dissolve 10 tsp.
(or 50 grams) of washing soda completely into the water.
Dissolve 4 tsp.
(or 5 grams) of ground coffee completely into the solution.
Dissolve 1 tsp.
(or 5 grams) of Vitamin C powder completely into the solution.
Wait up to 10 minutes for any bubbles to evaporate.
Make sure that you are in a completely dark area.
Load your film into the developing tank.
Pour the solution into the developing tank.
Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.
Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.
Continue for 10 to 20 minutes.
Pour the developing solution out.
Pour in 1 qt.
(or 1 lt.) of tap water.
Shake the tank gently for about 30 seconds.
Agitate the developing tank every minute for about 10 seconds by inverting it and shaking gently.
Pour out the water after 10 minutes.
Refill the tank with fresh tap water.
Repeat the rinse process.
Pour out the water after 10 minutes.
Remove the film.
Hang the film in a corner away from light, dust, and wind.
Wait until the films are dry to see your developed images.
